fixes.name: TC_Value
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau WINDOW_MAX(MAX([Value])) to a DAX measure that returns the MAX over the current selection/context using ALLSELECTED to emulate the window scope.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The Tableau expression uses a table calculation (WINDOW_MAX over an aggregation), which requires a measure in Power BI.

fixes.name: TC_Running Sum
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR __AllRows = ALLSELECTED('Data (Complaint Line)')
RETURN
SUMX(__AllRows, 'Data (Complaint Line)'[TC_Value])
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted Tableau RUNNING_SUM([TC_Value]) to a DAX measure that iterates over the current partition (ALLSELECTED) and sums the dependent TC_Value across those rows. Because Tableau's RUNNING_SUM is a table calculation that requires an ordering to produce a true running total and no ordering field was provided, this implementation returns the cumulative sum across the current selection/partition using the TC_Value measure defined above.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The Tableau expression uses a table calculation (RUNNING_SUM), so it must be implemented as a measure in Power BI.
